verb.description: Harm the good reputation of (someone or something)
examples: his remarks were taken out of context in an effort to discredit him

noun.description: Loss or lack of reputation or respect.
examples: they committed crimes that brought discredit upon the administration

origin: Mid 16th century: from dis- (expressing reversal) + credit, on the pattern of Italian ( di)scredito (noun), ( di)screditare (verb), and French discrédit (noun), discréditer (verb).
